timeline.author: AHeise

timeline.bodyText: What's the difference to the previous version? Especially in the behaviour? It looks like a subtle change that I'm missing.
timeline.author: pnowojski

replies.bodyText:
It is using CloseableIterator now, which recycles on unused elements on close().
Previous version recycled all buffers in cancel regardless of whether they were used or not.
replies.author: rkhachatryan

timeline.bodyText: Can you copy JIRA description to this commit description? By looking at it, it's quite hard to understand what is it fixing and how.
timeline.author: pnowojski

timeline.bodyText: Why have you dropped checkBufferType call? It was actually quite helpful couple of times when debugging. Can not we try to keep it?
timeline.author: pnowojski

replies.bodyText: It is now called when building iterator - in the same way as for InputChannel buffers.
replies.author: rkhachatryan

timeline.message:
[FLINK-18050][task][checkpointing] Use CloseableIterator to write ResultSubpartition state

Currently, buffers passed to ChannelStateWriterImpl can be recycled
twice: once in normal case after writing; second in
CheckpointInProgressRequest.cancel (called from ChannelStateWriteRequestDispatcher
and other places).

This change prevents this by using CloseableIterator which distinguishes
used and unused elements.
